content:
• Wednesday, February 13, 2013
  • BKS

    Barnes & Noble (NYSE:BKS) warns it expects FY13 (ends in April) Nook Media revenue to be...

    Barnes & Noble (NYSE:BKS) warns it expects FY13 (ends in April) Nook Media revenue to be below prior guidance of $3B. Also, the division's EBITDA loss is now expected to be above FY12 levels - prior guidance was for a comparable loss. Last month, BKS reported a 12.6% Y/Y drop in Nook division sales for the holiday season, and IDC estimated the company's Q4 tablet share fell nearly 60% Y/Y to a mere 1.9%. Shares -4.2% AH. FQ3 results are due on Feb. 28.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:15 PM | 2 Comments
  • SKX

    More on Skechers USA (NYSE:SKX): Q4 beats on both EPS and revenue as the retailer swung to a...

    More on Skechers USA (NYSE:SKX): Q4 beats on both EPS and revenue as the retailer swung to a fourth-quarter profit on a broad jump in sales, with particular strength in women's shoes. Total sales grew by 40% Y/Y, as its domestic wholesale business saw revenue increase 72%, while same-store sales grew in company-owned stores. Gross margin widened to 42.6% from 39.8%. Shares +11.8% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:52 PM | 1 Comment
  • STMP

    Tech guidance roundup: 1) Stamps.com (STMP - earnings) expects 2013 revenue of $120M-$130M and...

    Tech guidance roundup: 1) Stamps.com (STMP - earnings) expects 2013 revenue of $120M-$130M and EPS of $1.75-$1.95, below a consensus of $132.5M and $1.96. 2) Itron (ITRI - earnings) expects 2013 revenue of $2B-$2.1B and EPS of $3-$3.25; the former is in-line, but the latter is well below a consensus of $3.66. 3) Blucora (BCOR - earnings) expects Q1 revenue of $156M-$161M and EPS of $0.48-$0.52; the former is in-line, but the latter is soundly above a $0.36 consensus. STMP -22.3% AH. ITRI -10.1%. BCOR +9.9%.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:06 PM | 1 Comment
  • TRIP

    TripAdvisor (NASDAQ:TRIP) -9.4% AH following its Q4 report, even though it beat estimates and...

    TripAdvisor (NASDAQ:TRIP) -9.4% AH following its Q4 report, even though it beat estimates and established a $250M stock buyback (good for repurchasing 4% of shares). Search ad sales +25% Y/Y (+15% in Q3) and 73% of revenue. Display ads -3% (+12% prior), subscriptions and other +56% (+53% prior).  Liberty Interactive (LINTA) CEO Greg Maffei, whose company now controls 57% of TripAdvisor's voting rights, has been named chairman. TRIP has been on a good run since its Q3 beat. EXPE -0.7%. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 6:25 PM | 1 Comment

    Blucora (NASDAQ:BCOR): Q4 EPS of $0.24 beats by $0.05. Revenue of $97.5M (+46% Y/Y) beats by...

    Blucora (NASDAQ:BCOR): Q4 EPS of $0.24 beats by $0.05. Revenue of $97.5M (+46% Y/Y) beats by $3.59M. Shares +8.6% AH. (PR)

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: ANGI +21%. BCOR +12%. JCOM +7%. VCLK +6%. SGEN +5%....

  • BBY

    Best Buy (BBY -2%) founder Richard Schulze is mulling whether to scrap plans for a buyout of the...

    Best Buy (BBY -2%) founder Richard Schulze is mulling whether to scrap plans for a buyout of the struggling electronics chain and instead (along with other investors) obtain a minority stake, the WSJ reports. Sources claim Schulze, who owns ~20% of Best Buy, hasn't yet secured enough financing for a buyout, which is leading him to explore his options. But no decision has been made yet. The report led Best Buy to dive in the final minutes of trading after rallying earlier.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:45 PM | 3 Comments
  • Z

    Zillow (NASDAQ:Z)  reportedly guides on its Q4 call for Q1 revenue of $36M-$37M and 2013...

    Zillow (NASDAQ:Z)  reportedly guides on its Q4 call for Q1 revenue of $36M-$37M and 2013 revenue of $165M-$170M, above Street estimates of $34M and $160M. In spite of strong revenue growth, EBITDA margin is expected to stay flat, thanks partly to an expected 70% increase in sales/marketing spend. Q4 Markeplace revenue +95% Y/Y to $26.8M (+99% in Q3), ad revenue +22% to $7.5M (+15% in Q3). Z +5.2% AH in response to the guidance and a Q4 beat - shares rose 7.8% in regular trading following rival Trulia's Q4 report (I, II).
     
     
     
     
    | 5:37 PM | 1 Comment

    J2 Global Inc (NASDAQ:JCOM) declares $0.2325/share quarterly dividend, 3.3% increase from prior...

    J2 Global Inc (NASDAQ:JCOM) declares $0.2325/share quarterly dividend, 3.3% increase from prior dividend of $0.225. Forward yield 2.92%. For shareholders of record Feb. 25. Payable Mar. 04. Ex-div date Feb. 21. Shares +5.9% AH. (PR)

  • AMAT

    Tech guidance roundup: 1) Applied Materials (AMAT - earnings) expects FQ2 sales to grow 15%-25%...

    Tech guidance roundup: 1) Applied Materials (AMAT - earnings) expects FQ2 sales to grow 15%-25% Q/Q to $1.8B-$1.96B, above a $1.79B consensus. The company expects EPS of $0.09-$0.15 vs.a $0.10 consensus. 2) Equinix (EQIX - earnings) expects Q1 revenue of $518M-$522M, below a $524.9M consensus. 2013 revenue is expected to exceed $2.2B; the consensus is at $2.22B. 3) Angie's List (ANGI - earnings) expects Q1 revenue of $51M-$52M, above a $49.4M consensus. AMAT +2.8% AH. EQIX +1.9%. ANGI +21.1%
     
     
     
     
    | 5:16 PM
  • BEAT

    More on CardioNet (NASDAQ:BEAT): Posts a mixed Q4 despite an 11.9% jump in total sales Y/Y....

    More on CardioNet (NASDAQ:BEAT): Posts a mixed Q4 despite an 11.9% jump in total sales Y/Y. Despite an increase in overall patient volume, patient services revenue declined $2.7M primarily due to a shift in product mix to event and Holter monitoring which carry a lower reimbursement rate. Shares +2.4% AH.

    Hughes Corp. (HHC +7.6%) soared today as the company presented on its development plans at...

    Hughes Corp. (HHC +7.6%) soared today as the company presented on its development plans at the Harbor Investment Conference. CEO David Weinreb got a warm introduction from host (and owner of a big stake, not to mention Chairman) Bill Ackman, who called the property developer the "best kept secret on Wall Street."

(also: Q4 earnings)

  • CTL

    CenturyLink (NYSE:CTL): Q4 EPS of $0.67 misses by $0.01. Revenue of $4.58B misses by $10M....

    CenturyLink (NYSE:CTL): Q4 EPS of $0.67 misses by $0.01. Revenue of $4.58B misses by $10M. Expects Q1 revenue of $4.46B-$4.51B and EPS of $0.67-$0.72 vs. consensus of $4.55B and $0.66. Expects 2013 revenue of $18.1B-$18.3B and EPS of $2.50-$2.70 vs. a consensus of $18.2B and $2.64. $2B stock buyback program authorized, dividend lowered to $0.54/share from $0.725/share. Shares -10.7% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:20 PM | 9 Comments
  • AMZN

    More on Whole Foods Markets' (WFM) FQ1: Slowing growth and margin pressure are the themes as...

    More on Whole Foods Markets' (WFM) FQ1: Slowing growth and margin pressure are the themes as investors punish the grocery store operator for not matching its track record. Comparable store sales were up 7.2% during the period and the company sets 6.4% as its estimate for FQ2. The firm's new estimate for FY13 revenue growth of 10% to 11% is just slightly lower than its prior guidance of 10% to 12%. Shares -6.8% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:20 PM | 3 Comments

    Armour Residential (NYSE:ARR) announces a secondary offering of 65M shares (current float about...

    Armour Residential (NYSE:ARR) announces a secondary offering of 65M shares (current float about 309M shares) and preliminary Q4 data: REIT income should approximate dividends paid of $0.27. Book value/share of $7.28-$7.30 on Dec. 31 dropping to $6.70-$6.76 today. Shares -2.4% AH to $6.92. (PRs I, II)

  • VMW

    VMware (VMW -3.2%), Citrix (CTXS -1.7%), and Red Hat (RHT -1.5%). all of whom have made big bets...

    VMware (VMW -3.2%), Citrix (CTXS -1.7%), and Red Hat (RHT -1.5%). all of whom have made big bets on cloud management software, are closing lower following Rackspace's Q4 miss, which has spawned some growth concerns.  All 3 companies are nominally supporters of the OpenStack cloud infrastructure platform, which Rackspace helped create and strongly supports, though VMware is more focused on its rival vCloud platform and Citrix has its differences as well.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:01 PM | 1 Comment
  • BPL

    Buckeye Partners (BPL +1.6%) is upgraded to Buy from Hold with a $58 target price at Argus...

    Buckeye Partners (BPL +1.6%) is upgraded to Buy from Hold with a $58 target price at Argus following strong Q4 earnings, expecting continued strong earnings growth as BPL expands its network of domestic and international pipelines and terminals. The firm says BPL has done a fine job of controlling costs even as new capacity has been added.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:59 PM
  • IESC

    Integrated Electrical Services (IESC +4%) gains after amending its credit and security agreement...

    Integrated Electrical Services (IESC +4%) gains after amending its credit and security agreement to include a new two-year, $5M term loan and a one-year extension of the revolving credit facility to August 9, 2016. It plans use the proceeds to retire the $10M in senior notes held by Tontine Capital Overseas Master Fund II.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:51 PM
  • FITB

    Fifth Third Bancorp (FITB -2.9%) slides following its presentation at a conference (webcast) in...

    Fifth Third Bancorp (FITB -2.9%) slides following its presentation at a conference (webcast) in which the CEO says higher rates are tightening margins and could make the lender's mortgage business targets difficult to hit. He still feels positive about the bank's overall guidance thanks to strong fee income and strength in other areas.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:47 PM
  • FTI

    Energy production in the Gulf of Mexico is fueling a big boom in orders for specialized subsea...

    Energy production in the Gulf of Mexico is fueling a big boom in orders for specialized subsea equipment used in offshore wells, FMC Tech (FTI +4.9%) CEO John Gremp tells analysts in today's conference call. Demand for the equipment, anticipated for a while, is finally here, he says, with orders for subsea trees up 30%-40% last year with more to come in 2013. (Q4 earnings)

     
     
     
     
    | 3:39 PM
  • HNR

    Harvest Natural Resources (HNR +4%) shares are up on comments from Venezuela's oil minister that...

    Harvest Natural Resources (HNR +4%) shares are up on comments from Venezuela's oil minister that a proposed asset sale is still being evaluated. Last year, HNR said it wanted to sell its Venezuelan interests to Indonesia's Pertamina Persero. The oil minister says the sale has been delayed because some of the reserves still belong to Venezuela but the parties know what's needed to get state approval.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:20 PM
  • MSA

    Mine Safety Appliances (MSA +1.8%) moves up despite posting a mixed Q4, missing on its EPS but...

    Mine Safety Appliances (MSA +1.8%) moves up despite posting a mixed Q4, missing on its EPS but revenue comes in above Street expectations. Net earnings declined slightly, due largely to currency fluctuations the divestiture of some of its business lines. Separately, the company announces it's developed a new hard hat made from entirely from sugarcane, which reduces the overall carbon footprint associated with the entire life-cycle of the product.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:51 PM
  • AREX

    Approach Resources (AREX -2.5%) reports 2012 production averaging 7.9M boe/day, up 24% Y/Y, with...

    Approach Resources (AREX -2.5%) reports 2012 production averaging 7.9M boe/day, up 24% Y/Y, with total oil production of 969M barrels up 101% Y/Y. Estimates 2013 production of 3.6M-3.9M boe/day, with Q1 at 8.9 M-9.1M boe/day. Capex for 2013 is estimated at $260M.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:51 PM | 1 Comment
  • ZBRA

    Zebra Technologies (ZBRA +0.9%) signs a new group purchasing agreement with the Premier...

    Zebra Technologies (ZBRA +0.9%) signs a new group purchasing agreement with the Premier Healthcare Alliance to offer LaserBand's proprietary patient identification wristbands to their members.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:21 PM
  • HSP

    Hospira (HSP -5.7%) takes a hit today after posting better-than-expected Q4 results, but issuing...

    Hospira (HSP -5.7%) takes a hit today after posting better-than-expected Q4 results, but issuing a disappointing outlook for FY13. Net earnings swung to a profit amid stronger sales of its specialty drugs and the impact of a major write-down in the prior-year period, but the company warns that FY13 will be burdened by ongoing heavy costs to resolve regulatory concerns over manufacturing at some of its plants. It now expects to earn between $2.05 to $2.20 on net sales growth of 1% to 3%, below estimates of $2.31 on revenue growth of 4%.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:14 PM | 1 Comment
  • VG

    Vonage (VG +11.6%) has soared after: 1) Beating Q4 estimates. 2) Announcing a $100M stock...

    Vonage (VG +11.6%) has soared after: 1) Beating Q4 estimates. 2) Announcing a $100M stock buyback (currently good for repurchasing ~1/6 of shares). 3) Establishing a new $145M credit facility, $43M of which has been spent on retiring debt from a prior facility. 4) Forming a JV with Brazil's Datora Telecom to offer VoIP services in the country. Vonage's ARPU rose $0.84 Q/Q in Q4 to $30.15, but it saw a net loss of 5.7K lines (compared with a 9.4K gain in Q3). Churn was steady at 2.5%. (PR) (transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:06 PM
  • SD

    Also pushing higher on Leon Cooperman's 13F filing out earlier this afternoon is SandRidge...

    Also pushing higher on Leon Cooperman's 13F filing out earlier this afternoon is SandRidge Energy (SD +4.9%), as his Omega Advisors fund discloses a new 24.4M-share position. Shares hit 52-week lows during the Q4 period as TPG-Axon began agitating for a board shakeup, CEO change and possible sale.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:54 PM | 9 Comments
  • BWLD

    Restaurant stocks underperform broad market indexes after margin pressure at Buffalo Wild Wings...

    Restaurant stocks underperform broad market indexes after margin pressure at Buffalo Wild Wings and a dour industry outlook from AlixPartners sets a negative tone. Notable decliners: BWLD -5.4%, BJRI -3.7%, CAKE -2.5%, EAT -2.5%, DRI -2.2%, MCD -1.4%.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:46 PM | 2 Comments
  • MLNX

    Mellanox (MLNX +4%) is having a good day - as is often the case, The Fly on the Wall reports the...

    Mellanox (MLNX +4%) is having a good day - as is often the case, The Fly on the Wall reports the gains are due to M&A speculation. With 23.8% of the float was shorted as of Jan. 31, a short-squeeze isn't hard to produce. This morning, Mellanox announced Ethernet adapter card/switch solutions for the OpenStack cloud infrastructure platform; the hardware is meant to improve networking performance for virtualization deployments, and increase storage throughput.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:42 PM
  • IRWD

    Ironwood Pharmaceuticals (IRWD +0.9%) gains on an upgrade to Neutral today from Wedbush. The...

    Ironwood Pharmaceuticals (IRWD +0.9%) gains on an upgrade to Neutral today from Wedbush. The firm notes that early script data for Q1 suggests strong week-over-week Linzess growth, which, if sustained, would see Q1 and FY13 end-user demand well ahead of initial estimates.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:41 PM
  • CROX

    Shares of Crocs (CROX -0.7%) spike higher from negative territory after a SEC filing (13F)...

    Shares of Crocs (CROX -0.7%) spike higher from negative territory after a SEC filing (13F) reveals that Leon Cooperman has taken a new position of 2.149M shares.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:09 PM | 1 Comment
  • BB

    BlackBerry (BBRY -6.1%) adds to this week's losses following critical reports from National Bank...

    BlackBerry (BBRY -6.1%) adds to this week's losses following critical reports from National Bank and Wedge Partners. NB has slashed its estimates, isn't happy with the delayed U.S. rollout of the Z10 and Q10, thinks cash/share might fall by over $1 in FY14, and foresees a major drop in high-margin services revenue as BB7 subs migrate to BB10 (previous). Wedge says it's receiving signs "U.S. carriers are not optimistic" about Z10 sales, and considers iOS/Android "simply too entrenched" within the country.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:08 PM | 30 Comments
  • MDVN

    Medivation (MDVN +1.2%) gains today after presenting data for its monotherapy enzalutamide,...

    Medivation (MDVN +1.2%) gains today after presenting data for its monotherapy enzalutamide, showing it's treatment on prostate cancer has positive results. The study showed that the treatment increased serum testosterone by a mean of 114% at week 25 as compared to its baseline, and the median change in PSA was -99.6%.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:59 PM | 1 Comment
  • ARUN

    Aruba Networks (ARUN -5.6%) is selling off  after Wi-Fi hardware rivals NetGear and Ruckus...

    Aruba Networks (ARUN -5.6%) is selling off  after Wi-Fi hardware rivals NetGear and Ruckus Wireless provide disappointing calendar Q1 guidance (relative to investor expectations) to go with their Q4 reports (I, II). On its earnings call, NetGear (NTGR -9.5%) blamed its light guidance on weak service provider demand (not everyone is seeing the same) and macro challenges in the U.S. and Europe. Aruba's biggest rival, Cisco, reports after the close.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:52 PM | 1 Comment

    Midday top 10 gainers: RSOL +76%. RCON +27%. TRLA +25%. PRLB +24%. RPXC +22%. PRO +18%. ICAD...

  • MNST

    Monster Beverage (MNST +2.3%) CEO Rodney Sacks says unfounded criticism over the company's...

    Monster Beverage (MNST +2.3%) CEO Rodney Sacks says unfounded criticism over the company's energy drinks is behind the labeling change which will see ingredients and caffeine levels listed instead of supplemental facts. Shares have eased off their high earlier of $49.32 as persistent rumors that Greenlight Capital may be short the stock keep popping up.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:43 PM | 2 Comments
  • PLCM

    Polycom (PLCM -6%) slides after disclosing product/services chief Sudhakar Ramakrishna will be...

    Polycom (PLCM -6%) slides after disclosing product/services chief Sudhakar Ramakrishna will be leaving as of March 15 after having "accepted another opportunity." Polycom also says it has created an Office of the CTO that will consist of "top technical strategists and well-respected leaders," with one of them being engineering chief A.E. Natarajan. Videoconferencing archrival Cisco reports after the close.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:40 PM
  • CDMO

    Shares of Peregrine Pharmaceuticals (PPHM -2%) take a wild swing lower after opening solidly in...

    Shares of Peregrine Pharmaceuticals (PPHM -2%) take a wild swing lower after opening solidly in the green this morning on the back of news that its bavituximab treatment performed well in Phase II trials.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:35 PM
  • AMZN

    ChannelAdvisor's January data could be helping Amazon (AMZN +2.8%) rally: the firm's clients saw...

    ChannelAdvisor's January data could be helping Amazon (AMZN +2.8%) rally: the firm's clients saw a 34.3% Y/Y increase in Amazon same-store sales, up from 29.8% in December. eBay's (EBAY +0.2%) growth came in at 18.8%, down from December's 22.2%. In a positive for Google (GOOG +0.1%), search ad-driven sales grew 1% after falling 18% in December thanks to a migration to Google Shopping. Shopping engine sales (inc. Google Shopping) rose 7.9%, down from December's 15.5%. SA contributor Paulo Santos, a long-time Amazon bear, argues Amazon benefited from favorable comps.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:29 PM | 7 Comments
  • VMI

    Valmont Industries (VMI +4.4%) moves up on a solid Q4 earnings beat. Net profit fell however, as...

    Valmont Industries (VMI +4.4%) moves up on a solid Q4 earnings beat. Net profit fell however, as the year-earlier period's results were boosted by reorg-related gains, which offset the higher revenue. Gross margin widened to 27.5% from 25.9%.
